info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 6:39PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Catawba, southern Alexander and northwestern Iredell Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 639 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of Taylorsville, or over Stony Point, moving southwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Newton, Taylorsville, Hickory, St. Stephens, Conover, Bethlehem, Stony Point, Claremont, Catawba and Lookout Shoals Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
